meanings.definition: To give official permission or approval for something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher authorised the students to leave early for the day.
meanings.sent2: The manager authorised the purchase of new equipment for the office.
meanings.sent3: The cat authorised the dog to play with its favorite toy, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sun authorised the flowers to bloom, painting the garden in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The principal authorised the field trip, creating excitement among the students.

meanings.sent1: Only authorised personnel are allowed in the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The authorised signature on the document confirmed its validity.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt very authorised with its new collar, strutting around the house proudly.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky looked so authorised, twinkling with divine approval.
meanings.sent5: The badge made him feel authorised to enter the exclusive event.

meanings.definition: To empower or enable someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The mentor authorised her mentee to take the lead on the project.
meanings.sent2: The coach authorised the team to make their own decisions on the field.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand authorised the wizard to cast powerful spells with ease.
meanings.sent4: The key authorised access to the hidden chamber, revealing ancient treasures.
meanings.sent5: The certificate authorised her to practice law, marking a significant achievement.
